item.title: Word of the Day: unimpeachable
item.description: This word has appeared in 53 articles on NYTimes.com in the past year. Can you use it in a sentence?
item.dc:creator: The Learning Network

item.title: Nick Reiner Talked Openly About His Addiction Struggles
item.description: Nick Reiner was arrested and booked on suspicion of murdering his mother and father, the movie director, Rob Reiner. The younger Reiner had been open about his struggles with drug abuse and homelessness.
item.dc:creator: Shawn Paik

item.title: Bondi Suspects Were in Southern Philippines, Where ISIS Is Active
item.description: It remains unclear what the two men did there last month.
item.dc:creator: Jason Gutierrez and Sui-Lee Wee
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

media:content.media:credit: Ezra Acayan for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: A bombed-out building in Marawi in 2022, five years after Islamic State-affiliated militants and government forces waged a devastating battle for control of the city.

item.title: El desafío de Well: 5 días para tener un cerebro más sano en 2026
item.description: Te mostramos cómo mantener tu mente ágil y resistente durante años. Hacer el desafío con otra persona puede aportar beneficios aún mayores.
item.dc:creator: Dana G. Smith

item.title: Europe Is in Decline. Good.
item.description: Demotion need not be traumatic.
item.dc:creator: Anton Jäger

media:content.media:credit: Jan Staiger for The New York Times

item.title: In Sydney Suburb Where Suspects Lived, Neighbor Saw ‘No Dramas’
item.description: He said the people in the house were relatively new to the area and largely kept to themselves.
item.dc:creator: Livia Albeck-Ripka

media:content.media:description: Police officers at the house of the suspects’ family in the Bonnyrigg suburb of Sydney on Monday.

item.title: In a Remote Jungle, the Gruesome Poaching of Rare Elephants
item.description: More than a dozen Bornean elephants have been killed — including five beheaded — in Malaysia in the past 18 months, authorities say.
item.dc:creator: Richard C. Paddock, Zunaira Saieed and Sanjit Das

media:content.media:description: Henry Jamis, a ranger, next to the skeleton of a Bornean elephant near the Maliau Basin Conservation Area in Malaysia’s Sabah state last week.

item.title: Volkswagen to End Production at German Plant, a First in Company History
item.description: The auto giant stopped making cars at the plant in Dresden, which opened in 2001, as it faces weaker demand and steep U.S. tariffs.
item.dc:creator: Gregory Schmidt

media:content.media:description: Volkswagen’s site in Dresden, known as the “Transparent Factory,” will be converted to a technology research hub.

item.title: Corrections: Dec. 16, 2025
item.description: Corrections that appeared in print on Tuesday, Dec. 16, 2025.

item.title: Quote of the Day: How tech’s biggest powerhouses are investing in building out infrastructure while offloading risk.
item.description: Quotation of the Day for Tuesday, December 16, 2025.

item.title: Donald Trump Jr. Is Engaged to Bettina Anderson, a Palm Beach Socialite
item.description: The relationship between the president’s son and Ms. Anderson had been the subject of tabloid speculation during his previous engagement to Kimberly Guilfoyle.
item.dc:creator: Chris Cameron

media:content.media:description: Donald Trump Jr. and Bettina Anderson in Washington in June.

item.title: U.S. Strikes 3 More Boats in Eastern Pacific, Killing 8
item.description: The attacks brought the number killed since the Trump administration began the strikes on suspected drug smugglers to at least 95.
item.dc:creator: Nathan Willis
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces

media:content.media:description: An image taken from video released on Monday by the U.S. Southern Command.

item.title: NYT Crossword Answers for Dec. 16, 2025
item.description: You’ll have to complete Jason Reich’s crossword from start to finish.
item.dc:creator: Sam Corbin

item.title: Joe Ely, Texas-Born Troubadour of the Open Road, Dies at 78
item.description: Thanks to his eclectic style and tireless touring, he was among the most influential artists in the early days of Americana and alt-country music.
item.dc:creator: Clay Risen

media:content.media:description: Joe Ely in 1981. He wrote songs about lost love and endless vistas, built around stories of everyday people leading everyday lives.

item.title: At a Dark Moment, Jews in New York Celebrate the Festival of Lights
item.description: After the mass shooting at a Hanukkah celebration in Sydney, Australia, Jewish New Yorkers said they felt the need to stand up for their community.
item.dc:creator: Liam Stack, Olivia Bensimon and Wesley Parnell

media:content.media:credit: Victor J. Blue for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Some people at a menorah lighting at Grand Army Plaza in Brooklyn said the mass shooting in Australia had moved them to attend.

item.title: Live Updates: Sydney Gunmen Were Motivated by ISIS, Australia Prime Minister Says
item.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said two gunmen who killed 15 people at a Jewish holiday celebration were motivated by the Islamic State.
item.dc:creator: The New York Times

media:content.media:credit: Matthew Abbott for The New York Times

item.title: Kushner’s Firm Pulls Out of Trump-Branded Hotel Deal in Serbia
item.description: The announcement came just hours after prosecutors there charged four government officials with corruption in connection with the half-billion-dollar project.
item.dc:creator: Sharon LaFraniere and Lara Jakes

media:content.media:credit: Vladimir Zivojinovic for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: A real estate development project in Belgrade, Serbia, would have replaced bombed-out buildings with a luxury hotel bearing the Trump name.

item.description: Undated trap camera footage showing an armed poacher caught walking inside the Maliau Basin Conservation Area.
Community rangers patrolling inside the Maliau Basin Conservation Area on Saturday.

item.title: Brown Student Has Survived Two School Shootings
item.description: Mia Tretta, a Brown student, survived a deadly shooting at her high school in 2019 and another attack on Saturday. As the authorities search for the gunman in the latest attack, she is coping with trauma again.
item.dc:creator: Jamie Leventhal and Daniel Fetherston

media:content.media:credit: Christopher Capozziello for The New York Times

item.title: Gao Zhen, Detained Chinese Artist, Keeps Creating From Prison
item.description: 曾创作批评文革作品的艺术家高兟2024年回中国探亲时被捕，如今在等待审判，罪名是涉嫌侵害英雄烈士名誉。他的妻儿被禁止离开中国，高兟从狱中寄出信件和手撕画作，寄托对家人的爱意和思念。
item.dc:creator: Lily Kuo and Andrea Verdelli

media:content.media:credit: Andrea Verdelli for The New York Times

item.title: El héroe de Bondi: un australiano de origen sirio que desarmó a uno de los atacantes
item.description: El video de Ahmed el Ahmed desarmando a uno de los atacantes se ha vuelto viral, y autoridades de todo el mundo han elogiado su valentía.
item.dc:creator: Amelia Nierenberg and Yan Zhuang

item.title: Rob Reiner Is Said to Have Argued With His Son Nick at Conan O’Brien’s Holiday Party
item.description: Rob Reiner and his son, Nick, had a dispute at a party hosted by Conan O’Brien the night before the director and his wife were found dead.
item.dc:creator: Shawn Hubler, Brooks Barnes and Jason Zinoman

media:content.media:description: Rob Reiner and Nick Reiner at an event in 2016.

item.title: Nick Reiner’s Struggles With Drugs Left His Parents ‘Desperate’
item.description: Mr. Reiner, who was arrested in connection with the deaths of Rob and Michele Reiner, once estimated he had been in drug treatment 18 times as a teenager.
item.dc:creator: Julia Jacobs and Nicole Sperling

item.title: Wisconsin Judge Allows Election Case to Proceed Against Trump Advisers
item.description: A judge ruled that at least two of three defendants would have to stand trial in a case stemming from a plan to deploy fake electors after Donald Trump lost the 2020 presidential election.
item.dc:creator: Danny Hakim

media:content.media:credit: Lauren Justice for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Voting in Wisconsin in 2020. Wisconsin is one of five states that brought criminal charges related to the 2020 Trump campaign’s efforts to circumvent the outcome of the vote.

item.title: Trump Files $10 Billion Suit Over BBC Documentary
item.description: The British broadcaster, which has expressed regret over the editing of video clips about the president, has rejected claims that the error was evidence of a fundamental bias in its news reporting.
item.dc:creator: Michael D. Shear

media:content.media:description: The BBC’s board chairman apologized in a letter to a British parliamentary committee, saying the documentary’s editing had been an “error of judgment.”

item.title: Pelosi Long Resisted Stock-Trading Ban for Congress, Fueling Suspicion
item.description: The former speaker failed to appreciate the groundswell of support for banning the practice, refusing to give an inch amid G.O.P. accusations that she was corrupt.
item.dc:creator: Annie Karni

media:content.media:description: Nancy Pelosi’s legacy as the first woman to lead the House will include her years of resistance on banning lawmakers’ stock trading. She now supports the idea.

item.title: FBI Director Kash Patel, Eager for Spotlight, Casts Aside Caution in Social Media Posts
item.description: Kash Patel’s impulse to publicize the work of the bureau under his leadership has revived questions about his competence and his future in the administration.
item.dc:creator: Glenn Thrush and Devlin Barrett

media:content.media:credit: Eric Lee for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Even if Trump officials have privately criticized Mr. Patel, particularly over his use of government assets, rumors about his firing or forced resignation have yet to materialize.

item.title: Robert Samuelson, Award-Winning Economics Columnist, Dies at 79
item.description: He was a familiar byline in Newsweek and The Washington Post for decades, explaining the intricacies of economic policy in reader-friendly vernacular.
item.dc:creator: Michael S. Rosenwald

media:content.media:description: Robert Samuelson in his office in 2008. With no formal training in economics, he viewed himself as an outsider who translated dense but important policy debates for a broad audience.

item.title: Trial Opens for Judge Accused of Steering Immigrant Away from Federal Agents
item.description: “There was no corrupt intent,” the judge’s lawyer said in an opening statement. Prosecutors said the judge’s political views made her “cross the line.”
item.dc:creator: Julie Bosman

media:content.media:description: Judge Hannah C. Dugan outside the federal courthouse in Milwaukee on Monday.

item.title: Los multimillonarios se comportan cada vez más como Luis XV
item.description: Ser dueñas del mundo no es suficiente para estas personas; ahora también buscan el estímulo fácil de la celebridad en internet.
item.dc:creator: Michael Hirschorn

media:content.media:credit: Ilustración de Rebecca Chew/The New York Times

item.title: Svalbard-Geopolitcs
item.description: Svalbard-Geopolitcs

item.title: Huelga de un día en el Louvre; los turistas se quedan fuera
item.description: Alrededor de una quinta parte de los 2100 empleados del museo votaron a favor de pasar el día en huelga para pedir salarios más altos, una plantilla más numerosa, una mejor asignación de los recursos y una dirección que los escuche.
item.dc:creator: Ségolène Le Stradic and Ana Castelain

media:content.media:description: Los trabajadores se concentraron el lunes ante el Museo del Louvre de París para protestar por sus condiciones laborales, los problemas de personal y el estado de los edificios del museo.

item.title: 600 Readers Told Us About the Best Gifts They Ever Got. These Are the Top 13.
item.description: We asked readers to tell us about the most memorable presents they’ve received.
item.dc:creator: New York Times Opinion and Maisie Cowell

item.title: How the Winklevoss Twins Won Big in Trump’s Pro-Crypto Washington
item.description: Few industry players seem closer to Trump than the 44-year-old billionaire brothers. And they have gotten more than just invitations to the White House this year.
item.dc:creator: Sharon LaFraniere

media:content.media:description: Cameron and Tyler Winklevoss at the White House.

item.title: Rob Reiner’s Son Arrested After Fatal Stabbing
item.description: Also, police search for Brown University shooter. Here’s the latest at the end of Monday.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Cullen

item.title: E.U. Flies 110 Tons of Aid to Darfur. But Will It Reach Those In Need?
item.description: The European Union has mounted an “air bridge” effort, with at least eight aid flights planned to Sudan. But getting supplies to the areas with the most dire need is an enormous challenge.
item.dc:creator: Ephrat Livni

media:content.media:description: A camp in North Darfur, Sudan, for people displaced by the country’s civil war, which has created a humanitarian crisis.

item.title: Anthony Geary, Luke on ‘General Hospital,’ Dies at 78
item.description: Portraying Luke Spencer, he was one of the best-known soap opera stars in American television. His onscreen romance with Laura Webber, played by Genie Francis, changed the landscape of daytime television.
item.dc:creator: Sopan Deb

item.title: Rob Reiner Made Clear What He Believed In, Onscreen and Off
item.description: In films like “A Few Good Men,” the director’s ideas of honor and morality were stated as plainly as could be.
item.dc:creator: Alissa Wilkinson

item.title: Rob and Nick Reiner Made a Movie About a Turbulent Father-Son Relationship
item.description: Nick Reiner, who struggled with drug addiction, wrote “Being Charlie” during a period of sobriety. His father directed the film.
item.dc:creator: Melena Ryzik

media:content.media:description: Rob and Nick Reiner speaking about their film “Being Charlie” in New York in 2016.

item.title: Harvard’s President Will Stay in the Role Indefinitely
item.description: Alan M. Garber was appointed after his predecessor resigned under pressure. He has been in the role as Harvard fended off challenges from the Trump administration.
item.dc:creator: Vimal Patel

media:content.media:description: Harvard’s president, Alan M. Garber, at the college’s commencement in May.

item.title: The Next Steps for Gaza
item.description: A cease-fire is mostly holding, But tough issues remain, including the fate of Hamas weapons.
item.dc:creator: Katrin Bennhold

media:content.media:credit: Saher Alghorra for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: After an Israeli strike in Gaza City on Saturday.

item.title: Ford Will Take $19.5 Billion Hit as It Rolls Back E.V. Plans
item.description: Ford Motor said the costs came from its decision to make fewer electric vehicles than it had planned and more hybrids that use both gasoline engines and batteries.
item.dc:creator: Jack Ewing

media:content.media:credit: Brittany Greeson for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: A Ford F-150 Lightning electric truck at the company’s plant in Dearborn, Mich., in 2022. The Lightning will no longer be a pure electric vehicle.

item.title: Jewish Community on Edge Following Bondi Beach Attack
item.description: Following a deadly shooting on Sunday, members of the Australian Jewish community have expressed anger toward the government over a failure to do enough to address concerns about rising antisemitism in Australia.
item.dc:creator: Meg Felling

media:content.media:credit: Matthew Abbott for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Yvonne Haber, left, with other mourners at the site of the shooting in Sydney on Monday.

item.title: Controlling Blood Sugar Cut Heart Disease Risk in Half, New Study Says
item.description: People who brought their blood glucose down to a normal level had a lower risk of death from heart disease or hospitalization for heart failure after 20 years.
item.dc:creator: Nina Agrawal

media:content.media:credit: Rachel Bujalski for The New York Times

item.title: Albanese Vows to Toughen Gun Laws After Deadly Bondi Shooting
item.description: The police said on Monday that they expected to bring criminal charges against the surviving suspect, who is in a coma after being shot by the police.
item.dc:creator: Victoria Kim, Yan Zhuang and Michael Levenson

media:content.media:credit: Matthew Abbott for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: A makeshift memorial at Bondi pavilion, near the site of the attack, in Sydney, Australia, on Monday.

item.title: Heng Guan Documented China’s Detention of Uyghurs. The U.S. Wants to Deport Him.
item.description: Heng Guan fled to the United States and released rare video evidence of China’s clampdown. His supporters say that sending him to Uganda puts him at risk.
item.dc:creator: Amy Qin and Chris Buckley

item.title: Hotels on Grand Canyon’s South Rim to Reopen After Water Line Repairs
item.description: The National Park Service said hotels on the South Rim could again welcome guests starting on Wednesday after repairs to a broken water pipeline.
item.dc:creator: Gabe Castro-Root

media:content.media:description: Six hotels on the South Rim of the Grand Canyon, including the Bright Angel Lodge, are set to reopen on Wednesday after being closed since Dec. 6 for repairs to a water pipeline.

item.title: Police Share New Images of Man Sought in Deadly Shooting at Brown
item.description: The face of the man who officials believe killed two students was not visible in newly released footage, but they hoped he might still be recognized as the manhunt stretched past 48 hours.
item.dc:creator: The New York Times

media:content.media:credit: Christopher Capozziello for The New York Times

item.title: Reiners’ Son Arrested in Deaths of His Parents
item.description: Nick Reiner, 32, is being held without bail on suspicion of murder after the bodies of the director Rob Reiner and his wife, Michele, were found in their home.
item.dc:creator: The New York Times
